item.title: Best CPU Cooler For i5-11600k
item.dc:creator: denis
item.description: The Intel Core i5-11600K is one of Intel’s most solid desktop processors. It can handle most of the daily home and office computing tasks flawlessly. It also features a thermal design power of 125W. However, it does not have the required thermal solution, and the maximum allowed temperature is 212 degrees Fahrenheit. For a processor […]
item.content:encoded:
The Intel Core i5-11600K is one of Intel’s most solid desktop processors. It can handle most of the daily home and office computing tasks flawlessly. It also features a thermal design power of 125W.

However, it does not have the required thermal solution, and the maximum allowed temperature is 212 degrees Fahrenheit. For a processor as powerful as this one, you may need a CPU cooler. 

To make its performance sustainable, you may have to invest in the best CPU cooler for i5. This way, you can ensure you get the maximum efficiency from your PC.

In this article, we shall look at some of the best CPU coolers for i5-11600K available in the market. Let’s dive into it!

Quick Tips for Shopping Cooler for Your i5 11600k 

Before we indulge in the choices, let’s understand how to pick the best CPU cooler for i5. Here are some important factors you must look for when shopping for this product.

Thermal Design Power

Thermal Design Power or TDP is a vital factor to consider before purchasing a CPU cooler. TDP refers to the amount of heat a CPU produces when it works at its base clock. The TDP of this particular processor is 125 W. 

Hence, check the thermal design power of the cooler before purchasing it. In many cases, the air and liquid coolers specify the rating in their listing. However, if they do not, you can look up about them online.

If you buy a cooler with a lower TDP rating, the fan will function loudly, and the CPU may throttle. It can be damaging to the system in the longer run. So, it is wise to invest in a cooler with higher TDP ratings that run soundlessly and lower your CPU’s temperature significantly.

Types of Coolers

Primarily there are two types of coolers that you can choose from for your CPU. They are air coolers and water coolers.

Air Cooler

Air coolers can be an amazing choice for you if you have a custom desktop or laptop. Moreover, air coolers are the most popular kind of additional coolers when you need more than a stock cooler.

Generally, air coolers are larger than water coolers. Hence, it can not fit perfectly with multiple PC cases. Further, most air coolers, especially aftermarket ones, run at higher speeds and make louder noises.

Water Cooler

Water coolers or liquid coolers are an upgrade to air coolers. Usually, they perform better than air coolers at maintaining the temperature of the processor. Plus, they are available in a wide range of sizes to fit almost any system size.

However, you can avoid this if you do not use your system frequently and do not overheat all that much. Moreover, water coolers can be more expensive and potentially hazardous if the liquid ever leaks. 

Integrated Heat Spreader

Integrated Heat Spreader or IHS is the name for the top silver cover part on a CPU. It is a flat copper plate that protects the core of the CPU. So, why does IHS matter?

It is important because IHS provides a pathway for heat exchange between the cooler and the CPU. It also protects the processing silicon. Usually, soldered IHS is better than unsoldered since it provides a better path for heat exchange.

Thermal Interface Material

Thermal Interface Material or TIM is a very smooth component that bridges the IHS and the cooler. The smoother it is, the better the conductibility of the unit. However, it is very difficult to manufacture a completely smooth TIM. Hence, they use conductive or non-conductive pastes to smoothen it artificially. 

Quiet Operation

Most people prefer a quiet operating system over a noisy one. It is especially true if you are a gamer, graphic designer, or content creator. You would prefer to work in an environment with fewer noisy disturbances.

Therefore, it is a good factor to look for when buying a new cooler for your PC. Moreover, most high-quality coolers ensure to incorporate quiet operation as a feature.

Style

CPU coolers usually stand out in the crowd of numerous components. Hence, it is safe to say the style of the coolers is an important factor to consider. So, do not forget to choose a cooler based on its style after its performance.

Moreover, there are many types of coolers available in the market. They come in a multitude of sizes, shapes, colors, and designs. So, pick what you like so the aesthetic will be pleasing every time you see through the case window.

RGB

Many people prefer a color with an RGB customization option. If you are one of them, you should definitely go for it! You can choose from a wide variety of RGB coolers that offer RGB lighting and fans.

Additionally, it is important to ensure you can turn on and off the RGB whenever you want to. It can have a built-in controller or a compatible motherboard header while you plug it in. 

Nonetheless, it can be helpful when you can turn off the RGB lights without turning off your system.

How Do I Know What Cooler Will Fit in My System?

No matter which type or style of cooler you are opting for, you need to ensure it fits your system. So, how can you know if the cooler you like fits your CPU?

Firstly, you must check for the CPU socket and any potential chassis limitations for cooler height or radiator size for i5 11600k. A socket is a part that provides an electrical and mechanical connection between the motherboard and the processor.

You can check the “Socket Supported” in the CPU package, its official website, or the product listing. Then, compare the socket information, the TPD of the i5 11600k, with the socket info on the cooler. 

If it matches, you know the cooler is going to fit in your system. Moreover, the socket supported for i5-11600k is FCLGA1200.

Installing CPU Cooler for i5-11600k

To ensure you are installing your CPU cooler correctly, I am providing you a guide. Here is a step-by-step process of installing a CPU cooler.

Step #1. Apply Thermal Paste

Before you fix your cooler in your CPU, check for thermal paste. It is a thin layer of a thermal compound that removes the gap between the cooler’s base and the CPU lid. Most coolers come with thermal paste in place, yet not all of them do.

So, if it is not there, you can apply the thermal paste. Remember to apply only a small amount. All you have to do is apply a small dot of the paste in the center of the CPU lid.

Step #2. Set Up Standoffs

This step is an optional step depending on the cooler and motherboard combination. You can use a standoff that screws through the motherboard into the case or a bracket that sits behind the motherboard. 

If the cooler you purchase comes with these components, attach them after seeing if they are appropriate. Also, if you are using a water cooler, you have to install the radiator in your case.

Step #3. Attach the Cooler

Firstly, line up the screws with the holes in the motherboard carefully. Then, lower the cooler into the CPU and screw in the connectors. You can use an X pattern to screw it tight.

Start by tightening loosely at first, then increase the tension as you go on. Make sure to screw in evenly across the board since it can create uneven pressure distribution if you do not. Then, attach any fans or connect them to the radiator depending on the type of cooler.

Step #4. Plug-In

Once you attach everything in the CPY, you have to plug in everything. All parts need power despite the type of cooler. The plugging varies from one cooler to another so that you can connect it according to its design.

Top 5 Best CPU Cooler For i5 11600k: Comprehensive Reviews

Here are my top 5 picks for this list of the best CPU Cooler For i5 11600k. Check out the detailed review on each of these products to know if they suit all your needs!

Best Overall – be quiet! Dark Rock 4, BK021, 200W TDP, CPU Cooler

The first product on my list of the best CPU cooler for i5-11600K is quiet! Dark Rock 4, BK021, 200W TDP, CPU Cooler. This cooler is my favorite cooler for a wide range of reasons. Firstly, it features 13mm PWM fans that operate virtually inaudible.

It has a highly advanced design which can be an excellent upgrade to your old coolers. It has six advanced 6mm copper heat pipes that maximize heat conductance. Moreover, it provides optimized airflow with wave-contoured cooling fins.

This cooler has a single tower layout design that provides excellent heat dissipation even in small spaces. Although only one fan is pre-installed, you can add another 120 mm fan for more cooling. 

It also has an impressive 200W TDP rating that can maintain cool temperature even during my computer’s peak performance.

Conclusion

This cooler offers virtually an inaudible operation with a size-pole motor for less vibration. Moreover, the 200W TDP is perfect for all my requirements, including gaming and editing works.

Moreover, it has a white LED illumination pump head. It adds a touch of beauty and sophistication to your system build. It also has an impressive thermally optimized cold plate.

On top of this great performance comes the TDP peak of 150W. Yeah, I am thinking the same thing as you are! These statistics mean a hell of a […]
item.content:encoded:
Are you a big-time i7 11700K fan? Well, why shouldn’t you be? It is crazy affordable and wins over the i9 11900K in the single-thread tests.

On top of this great performance comes the TDP peak of 150W. Yeah, I am thinking the same thing as you are! These statistics mean a hell of a lot of heat. The CPU doesn’t come with an included cooler, and it might get tricky for some of us to choose the best CPU Cooler in the market!

No stress, I am here to help with a comprehensive buying guide of the Best CPU Coolers for i7 11700K! Read on to know more 

Preview Product Rating Price
Noctua NH-D15, Premium CPU Cooler with 2X NF-A15 PWM 140mm Fans... 9,127 Reviews $99.95 Buy now
Scythe Mugen 5 Rev.B CPU Air Cooler, 120mm Single Tower, Intel... 2,541 Reviews $138.00 Buy now
be quiet! Dark Rock Pro 4, BK022, 250W TDP, CPU Cooler 13,252 Reviews $89.90 Buy now
ARCTIC Liquid Freezer II 280 - Multi Compatible All-in-One CPU... 1,320 Reviews $103.99 Buy now

Quick Buying Guide

I shall now be dictating a few things that you can keep in mind while deciding on the CPU Cooler you need! These factors are essential and generally make or break our decision.

TDP or Thermal Design Power

Well, I can’t say it enough, but TDP matters the most when it comes to CPU Cooler. On a cooler buying spree? Always check for the handleable TDP Value at the back of the product.

Now, you may think, what is this TDP? Thermal design power refers to the maximum heat produced by a processor at its peak performance. 

Now, if the cooler can handle the heat given off by the processor, you’re winning! If not, then my friend, your money might have gone to waste, and I wouldn’t want that for you!

So, make it a rule to check the TDP value of both your CPU and the value your CPU cooler can handle.

Cooler Type

The market has an array of CPU coolers. They might look the same from the top, but let me tell you, they function very differently!

The types are air coolers or Liquid Coolers broadly. Another type is the Open Loop Coolers.

Air Coolers

Air Coolers are the best fit for a low budget and a good investment. The only reason to pick Air coolers is because of the fewer moving parts and easy installation! 

They mainly have metal heatsinks and fans in their composition. A variety of shapes, sizes, and TDP based air coolers are there in the market!

Liquid Coolers

If you can spend a little extra buck on your CPU Cooler, I will surely recommend Liquid Coolers. Even though they are expensive, you get the best of features.

They work at the maximum capacity too with quiet performance! It is in contrast with the functioning of air coolers. 

You won’t have to maintain coolant levels for liquid coolers, and the cooling method will be entirely water-based. With water, you might be stuck at whether there would be any leakage or not? So, guys, no worries, these coolers are leak-resistant!

Additionally, the ease of installation is a bright feature. You can also invest in some overclocking!

Open Loop Coolers

Open Loop Coolers are pricey bets. But the coolest part is that you get top-class results and great cooling abilities.

 On the negative side, the whole build is very complicated and complex. Understanding the specifications of Open Loop Coolers might take some time! 

Socket Compatibility

Next up, we have the factor of CPU Socket compatibility. Imagine you bought a cooler, and now it isn’t able to fit the socket of your CPU. Such a sad story. 

That is why you must always check for a model that can fit your CPU in the best and most effective manner.

RAM Compatibility

RAM compatibility? It sounds like a term you all might have heard. RAM compatibility is an essential part of purchasing a CPU Cooler. The standard RAM Modules that are around 33 mm go well with most CPU Coolers. 

RAM with tall heat spreaders might be the cause of an issue. These RAM modules with greater heights and big cooler models may cause heat sinking. The fan might even overhang RAM Slots.

To prevent such mishaps, do check the compatibility of RAM with your cooler.

Motherboard

So we talked about RAM and Socket Compatibility; what’s next? The motherboard.  Choosing a cooler that can fit the motherboard is essential. 

But the question arises how we can find that out? Go online and find some motherboard compatibility charts! You will be surprised to know the number of them available just to help you make a more balanced decision.

Cooler Height and Case Compatibility

Both the cooler height and case compatibility need to be aligned to have a great CPU cooler fit. You will have to figure out the clearance space for the CPU Cooler. Once you know that, go for a cooler with a similar height or clearance.

Noise

Does a quiet performance impress you? Do you want a great cooling performance? I am hoping the answer to both these questions is a big yes.

Now that we have our priorities set, choosing a cooler becomes an easy job! Generally, a high-performance cooler has low-speed fans and thus less noise. On the other hand, a maxed-out cooler shall have high-speed fans and produce noise when overclocking the CPU.

Overclocking

This term was mentioned previously as well! Overclocking means making the CPU work way faster than the already set limits. High-profile coolers will have the ability to sustain overclocking. Low profile ones only work with the lower TDP CPUs.

I am also attaching a link to a video highlighting some main features to be thoughtful about while making that perfect CPU purchase! Interested? Click on the link below.

Review of the 4 Best CPU Coolers for Intel Core i7 11700K

Noctua NH-D15: Best Overall

Noctua NH D-15 is genuinely the jack of all trades. Whether it’s AMD Ryzen or its Intel, Noctua chooses to win irrespective! But what makes this CPU cooler the great pick that it is?

Noctua NH D-15 comes with two NF-A15 140mm fans. Along with the fans, you get PWM support as well. Imagine these superior quality fans performing at their best capacity with no noise! Sounds like a dream, right? Well, not so much for Noctua.

Noctua provides users the quiet cooling they deserve through this model. The fan also has an automatic speed control. This feature provides the high efficiency required by the cooler.

I cannot skip design when talking about Noctua NH D-15! This CPU cooler has a great design with about six heat pipes and two fans. It also has a high-end NT H1 thermal paste and SecuForm2 mounting system to promote an easy installation.

On top of all these features, Noctua has been a trusted brand for many years. It has won about 250 awards and various recommendations from people all over the globe!

Conclusion

Noctua NH D-15 is a safe bet, in all honesty. Great features with a  great performance. These two things rarely go wrong together. If you have been searching for a great CPU cooler for your Intel core processor, Noctua is a brand you should try at least once!

Scythe Mugen 5 Rev B: Best Budget

I have always been a fan of reasonably priced stuff! Well, who isn’t? We all start to sweat when it comes to CPU coolers, knowing that it will be an expensive deal. What if I tell you that’s not the case? And that you can get a CPU Cooler for less than $ 50?

Hahaha! I know you’re surprised. Scythe Mugen 5 Rev B is the one for you. The price is extremely low, and the features are top-notch.

The 120 mm Kaze Flex Fan performs a variety of functions. It keeps care of the high airflow and static pressure. Along with that, the fans perform in a very quiet manner, even at a high capacity. With Mugen 5, you all can say goodbye to the noise!

There is an additional fan clip in the set too. That is given just in case users want another optional fan. These extra fans promise to give high performance and work in a push-pull configuration. 

Just like Noctua, Scythe also provides users with a thermal compound paste. It is also highly compatible with both AMD Ryzen and Intel. 

As far as CPU Socket compatibility is concerned, Scythe Mugen 5 wins hands down! Yes, we mean it. Scythe Mugen 5 Rev B boasts of a spring-loaded mounting system. This system promotes a more easy and secure installation.

You will also get an asymmetrical design with the product. This design is a great help in the RAM compatibility and the unrestricted access to memory banks.

Conclusion

Life may be tough, but choosing an affordable CPU Cooler isn’t. I recommend you to go for the Scythe Mugen Rev 5. It is a great combination of reasonable prices and high-quality features. Sounds like a nice plan to me!

Just like its name, this CPU cooler promises to give the quietest performance ever! The credit goes to the two virtually inaudible quiet-wing PWM fans. The sound levels for this CPU Cooler are extremely low (somewhere around 24.3 Db), with the highest fan speed possible. 

This CPU Cooler boasts seven high-performance copper heat pipes. Along with these heat pipes, you get airflow optimized cooling fins. It is an excellent fit for demanding workstations.

The design to be Quiet! Dark Rock Pro 4 CPU Cooler is pretty great. This German product’s conception, quality control, and build are among the best in the market! The top cover for this cooler is made of brushed aluminum and has an overall diamond-cut finish.

Arctic Liquid Freezer 11 AIO CPU Cooler: Best Overclocking Cooler 

Do you have a habit of overclocking your system? Are you a big-time gamer who spends long hours online? If you participate in either one of these habits, you will know how big of an issue it is. It becomes difficult to find CPU Coolers that match your requirements. 

Well, All hail Arctic Liquid Freezer AIO CPU cooler to rectify all these worries. This CPU Cooler promises to be way cooler than the other options in the market. It has a more efficient cool plate, pump, and radiator. These components make it a true blue AIO Cpu Cooler.

The CPU Cooler has an additional 40MM VRM Fan attached near the pump. This fan provides cooling to the base and the voltage transformer. The lower voltage Redualtor temperature stands at 15 degrees Celsius, which is pretty great.

Cables are incredibly managed in the Arctic CPU Cooler. The PWM Cable of the fans is put together in sleeved tubing! Overall there is essentially a single cable that users can see on the top of the pump to the motherboard. 

This cooler is a huge relief for all those sick and tired of the cable mess in CPU Coolers.

Another fantastic feature for this CPU cooler would have to have 80% less power consumption! Arctic brings across this new feature which genuinely makes their CPU cooler stand out. 

Now whenever the pumps are idle, they clock down and thus consume way less power. The noise is also minimum whenever cooling isn’t required.

A solid extended warranty backs the whole idea of the Arctic Liquid Freezer AIO CPU cooler. The company offers a six-year warranty from the day of purchase. 

Users won’t have to worry about refilling since the water loop is religiously sealed. It also has high-quality fiber-reinforced EPDM tubing!

Conclusion

If you are a gamer and have a habit of overclocking, this CPU Cooler might just be the solution for you. Arctic Liquid Freezer AIO CPU cooler is made to help users in heat dissipation and provide the best experience ever! 

I am into gaming, and the cool plate of this CPU Cooler is a winner!

item.title: 5 Best CPU Coolers For Ryzen 7 3700x – A Buying Guide
item.dc:creator: denis
item.description: If you are a gamer or someone with knowledge about CPUs, you will know Ryzen Zen 2 CPU is a top choice! This CPU has eight cores and 16 threads. On top of that, you get a great build and performance. Additionally, you get all these cool features at a reasonable price as well. So, […]
item.content:encoded:
If you are a gamer or someone with knowledge about CPUs, you will know Ryzen Zen 2 CPU is a top choice! This CPU has eight cores and 16 threads. On top of that, you get a great build and performance.

Additionally, you get all these cool features at a reasonable price as well. So, what’s the issue here? These power-packed CPUs heat up quickly, and you need to cool the temperature to avoid any damage. What do we do now?  Enter CPU Coolers! (They are all you need)

If you’re looking for the best CPU Coolers for Ryzen 7 3700x, we have got you covered. Let’s jump in!

Some Tips to Buy the Perfect CPU Cooler

With the market gushing with options, selecting the correct CPU Cooler can be a tricky job. There are various things to consider, and specifically the features with which these CPU coolers come.

To make things a little short, I have a video here detailing some of the essential points to keep in mind before you spend your hard-earned money. Click on the link below to get enlightened. 

Got a nice idea about choosing the right CPU cooler? Yay, I hope so!

Now, for the people who would rather read to get a descriptive idea of these parameters, read on! 

CPU Cooler Type

The CPU coolers available in the market are broadly divided into air, closed-loop, or all-in-one coolers and, lastly, custom/ open-loop cooling setups. 

Air Coolers 

Air Coolers consist of metal heatsinks and fans. You can buy them in various shapes, sizes and, not to forget, based on thermal dissipation capacities or TDP. 

Open Loop Coolers

Open Loop Coolers are the most expensive options sold in the market; they are extremely complex as well. You might take some time to understand their nitty-gritty.

On the brighter side, Open Loop Coolers tend to provide top-notch results and cooling performance. 

AIO or Closed Loop Coolers

AIO coolers are also referred to as Liquid Coolers. These CPU Coolers are known for their low noise production while working at maximum efficiency. (specifically comparing to air coolers).

For AIO coolers, you won’t have to cut and fit custom tubes. Neither will you have to maintain coolant levels. 

They are even leak-resistant and extremely user-friendly when it comes to the installation part. The only negative is the requirement of the larger case since they need space for a radiator.

CPU Socket

Buying the CPU Cooler and not being able to fit it in your sockets would be such a  waste of money! To save yourself from this misery, almost always choose the cooler model which fits your CPU socket comfortably.

You can go over socket compatibility charts available online to get a clearer idea!

Motherboard

Just like your CPU Socket, the motherboard also plays a big role in CPU Cooler selection. You must look for a Cooler that fits your motherboard. You can check for the details using Motherboard compatibility lists on the internet.

Case Compatibility and Cooler Height

Case Compatibility, along with the cooler heights together, accounts for a perfect CPU Cooler fit. The amount of clearance for coolers will depend on the different PC cases. Make a note of the clearance required by your pick of coolers, or calculate the clearance from the case.

Once you have the desired value of clearance, go for the CPU cooler that fits these specifications.

Ram Compatibility

Standard RAM modules (up to 33 mm) are extremely compatible with almost all cooler models. The issue arises when the user goes for RAM with taller heat spreaders.

Some big cooler models will heat sink themselves, or the fan might overhang the RAM slots on a motherboard when used with RAM Modules of greater heights.

All in all, you should check the popular models and their tendency to overhang the memory slots.

CPU TDP (Thermal Design Power) and Overclocking

The CPU size and design make a lot of difference when choosing a CPU cooler. Generally, big coolers have better cooling performance. These CPU coolers would suit higher TDP CPUs and overclock.

What does overclocking mean, though? Overclocking is the tendency to make your CPU work faster than its stipulated limits. 

Similarly, lower TDP CPUs will work fine with low profile cooler models

Noise

How does noise become a factor here? Well, for starts, as a user, you will, of course, prefer to use a system that works quietly as possible. Cooling performance and noise-making are far more related than you thought. 

A cooler with extra performance headroom for the CPU will have fans with low speeds and less sound.  On the contrary, your CPU’s fully maxed-out cooler shall have fans with high speeds once the CPU is under load.

Keeping all these parameters in mind, you should choose a CPU cooler that matches your CPU’s TDP class, overclocking tendencies and acceptable noise production. 

PCIe Compatibility

Just like I mentioned the CPU slot and motherboard compatibility, PCIe compatibility is a crucial point too. Big coolers may tend to overhang the top PCIe slot. 

How do we figure this out, then? I have observed that the whole compatibility largely depends on the cooler size, top PCIe slot placement, and CPU socket location. 

One should look for compact CPU Coolers that would be compatible in all cases and don’t overhang the top PCIe slot.

So, these are the top factors to be analyzed while buying the best CPU cooler for Ryzen 7 3700X or any other processor for that matter! Next up, I have my personal top 5 CPU coolers to give you the best cooling performance all the time!

Review of the 5 Best CPU Coolers for Ryzen 7 3700x

item.dc:creator: denis
item.description: The Ryzen 5 3600 is an amazing 65W chip that is quite a pack of power in a small thermal envelope. Moreover, it provides affordable gaming power to anyone looking for it.  However, a common issue with Ryzen 5 3600 is it overheats fast. So, the stock cooler Wraith Stealth is not enough.  In this […]
item.content:encoded:
The Ryzen 5 3600 is an amazing 65W chip that is quite a pack of power in a small thermal envelope. Moreover, it provides affordable gaming power to anyone looking for it. 

However, a common issue with Ryzen 5 3600 is it overheats fast. So, the stock cooler Wraith Stealth is not enough. 

In this article, we shall walk through some of the best CPU coolers for Ryzen 5 3600 available in the market. These aftermarket CPU coolers can help you make the best out of the processor’s performance.

Also, I can help you pick the best CPU cooler for Ryzen 5 3600 for your requirements. So, let’s get started!

A Quick Buyer’s Guide

Here are some important factors to consider while picking a cooler for Ryzen 5 3600. These factors will ensure you get the best value for your hard-earned money!

Types of Coolers

There are primarily two types of coolers that you can pick from that offer excellent cooling. Here are the primary two categories: Liquid coolers and air coolers.

Liquid Coolers

Liquid coolers or water coolers use distilled water or other liquids to perform cooling. They are generally more effective at maintaining cooler temperatures during peak performance than air coolers. However, they are more difficult to maintain than air coolers.

You can go with liquid coolers if you are a gamer or someone who uses the processors at their peak for a long time. Otherwise, it may simply not be worth the money you pay for since liquid coolers are usually more expensive.

Air Coolers

Air coolers are an excellent alternative for stock coolers. Moreover, air coolers are generally popular than liquid coolers since they are effective and inexpensive.

Further, air coolers are quite larger than water coolers, yet they are available in a wide range of sizes. They also make more noise at higher speeds than liquid or water coolers.

TDP (Thermal Design Power)

TDP is one of the most important factors to consider while investing in a CPU cooler. The TDP for Ryzen 5 3600 is 65W. It refers to the heat a CPU produces when it works at its base clock.

When you are looking for a cooler, ensure the cooler has more TDP than the processor. You can find the TDP rating on the cooler’s product listing. If you do not find it on the product listing or packaging, you can check their official website.

Speed

Speed is an important factor since it plays a vital role in cooling your CPU. The processor is safe when the cooler is propelling air through at an accelerated speed.

Hence, I recommend you choose coolers with a decent spinning speed if it is an air cooler. On the other hand, ensure the liquid component is strong if you plan to purchase a liquid cooler. It should act fast and stay durable for the most efficient temperature reduction.

Noise Levels

The level of noise a cooler produces during its operation is an important factor to acknowledge. If the noise levels of the coolers are too high, it can cause many inconveniences. 

Firstly, it can disturb you with your work. Secondly, the sound waves can interfere with other components in the CPU. Although most high-quality coolers ensure to perform in lowered noises, you may have to discard a good performer for its noise levels.

RGB

RGB is an excellent feature, yet it is only an option. If you are interested in flashy lights that make your PC look edgier. 

However, make sure to prioritize necessary factors such as performance, durability, and noise levels over RGB. On the other hand, if you do not like the flashy lights or think it is unnecessary, you do not have to waste your time on this feature.

Ease of Installation

Usually, AIO (All in One) coolers are more complex to install than a standard cooler. However, the ease of installation depends on the model of the cooler and your processor. Hence, it is important to pick a cooler that is easy to install on your PC.

Water or liquid coolers are more difficult to install than air coolers. It is so because it involves an extra step of installing the radiator and fans.

Size

Air coolers are generally bulkier than water coolers. However, the entire structure stays on one area instead of liquid coolers that you have to distribute across the system. You will need space for the radiator, and it has to be in the proper orientation.

Hence, if you want something effective, you can go with air coolers in a small area. Moreover, they are available in a wide range of sizes. If you want a low-profile air cooler and have enough space for alignment, you go with liquid coolers.

Preview Product Rating Price
Corsair H115i RGB Platinum AIO Liquid CPU Cooler,280mm,Dual ML140... No ratings yet $134.99 Buy now
Noctua NH-L12S, Premium Low Profile CPU Cooler with Quiet 120mm... 1,334 Reviews $86.59 Buy now

Noctua NH-D15, Premium CPU Cooler with 2X NF-A15 PWM 140mm Fans... 9,127 Reviews $99.95 Buy now

Are Air Coolers Better Than Liquid Coolers?

Generally, liquid coolers are better than air coolers. However, it entirely depends on the manufacturing quality and design of the cooler. 

Usually, liquid coolers have many exclusive features that make the cooling more efficient. Yet both the type of coolers are highly effective if you implement them properly. However, entry-level liquid coolers can be substantially expensive.

Should You Replace the Liquid in Liquid Coolers Often?

No, you do not have to replace it often or at any time. It requires less interaction since the coolers have auto-renew technology. In this technology, they renew the liquid automatically using flush methods.

How to Install a CPU Cooler for Ryzen 5 3600?

It is quite easy to install a cooler for Ryzen 5 3600. I have mentioned a few pointers in a step-by-step manner below to help you with the installation.

Apply the thermal paste if it is not already there. You will have to start by unscrewing the pre-attached brackets on the motherboard.

Then, you will have to mount the cooler. You can mount it away from the RAM to have fewer RAM clearance issues.

Place the best CPU cooler for Ryzen 5 3600 you pick and screw it in a diagonal pattern. Also, apply some pressure while tightening the screws as they are spring-loaded. Yet remember to tighten it gradually without pressuring it too much.

Finally, once you ensure it is properly in place, you can connect the fan header to the motherboard’s CPU fan header. Then, plug in everything that you should.

Top 5 Best CPU Cooler for Ryzen 5 3600

Let’s check out five of my top picks for the best CPU cooler for Ryzen 5 3600. I have presented a detailed review of each of these choices. Plus, I have included a list of pros and cons.

Best Overall Cooler – Corsair H115i RGB Platinum AIO Liquid CPU Cooler

First, on my list of the best CPU cooler for Ryzen 5 3600, I have Corsair H115i RGB Platinum AIO Liquid CPU Cooler. Let’s take a closer look at its features and find out what’s special about this cooler. 

It is one of the most popular water coolers available in the market for its high performance and excellent airflow capacity. It has an RGB magnetic levitation PWM fan that delivers improved airflow along with a beautiful blast of colors. The airflow is 97 CFM, which is pretty impressive.

Furthermore, it has individually controlled RGB LED lights that you can use to produce customized lighting effects. Its CORSAIR iCUE software lets you control the lighting. It also allows you to adjust coolant temperatures and fans.

You can expect high performance and low noise cooling with the thermally optimized plate. The fans can also run between the speeds of 400 to 2400 rpm. Finally, it is very easy to install, which is an important feature.

Conclusion

It is a high-performing cooler suitable for Ryzen 5 3600. Further, you can customize the stunning RGB colors along with fan speed. Plus, it has a thermally optimized cold plate with a low noise pump.

Next up, we have one of the best compact coolers for Ryzen 5 3600. It is by the popular cooler brand Noctua. Let’s check this compact yet power-packed cooler and its feature as you read on.

Noctua NH-L12S Premium Low Profile CPU Cooler is an excellent low power cooler. The total height of this cooer is only 70 mm, (5.04 L x 5.75 W x 2.76 H inches). Despite its size, it has 12 volts and 1.56 power.

Furthermore, it is an improved successor to the NH-L12, perfect for ITX and HTPC systems. Moreover, it is further optimized with an NF-A12x15 which is 120mm. It also includes a low-noise adaptor that provides ultra-quiet operation and offers automatic speed control.

This cooler also includes high-end NT-H1 thermal paste, which is quite effective. Plus, it has an easy installation on Ryzen 5 3600. It also has a SecuFirm2 mounting system which secures the cooler in the system.

Conclusion

If you are looking for something low-profile and quiet, this cooler can be a fantastic choice for you. It has a design suitable for HTPC environments and Form Factor cases. It also provides excellent performance with tall RAM modules when it is on high clearance mode.

It has an additional fan clip if you want to add additional fans. It also has a push and pulls configuration for maximum performance. This configuration also ensures the air inside the CPU is cool and fresh all the time.

With these coolers, RAM modules with tall heatsinks are not a problem. It has an asymmetric design which allows excellent access to the memory banks. It is one of the main reasons why this cooler is my top pick for Ryzen 5 3600.

It has 6 x 6 mm heat pipes and a copper plate base. This feature will ensure better heat dissipation and cooling. Moreover, these coolers are very easy to install with their spring-loaded mounting system. 

Conclusion

You can pick this if you are looking for a very easy cooler highly-priced to install and work efficiently. The high airflow capacity (51.17 cubic feet per minute) ensures better cooling. Further, I appreciate its push-pull configuration, which helps during long hours of work.

item.title: The best 4K gaming monitor in 2021
item.dc:creator: denis
item.description: The Best 4K Gaming Monitor In 2021 If you’ve wanted to improve your gaming experience, there has never been a better time to buy a 4K gaming monitor. With recent technological developments, your options are limitless, and there is a 4K monitor for everyone. A 4K gaming monitor will offer the best user experience, high […]
item.content:encoded:
The Best 4K Gaming Monitor In 2021

If you’ve wanted to improve your gaming experience, there has never been a better time to buy a 4K gaming monitor. With recent technological developments, your options are limitless, and there is a 4K monitor for everyone.

A 4K gaming monitor will offer the best user experience, high resolution, large screen size, and fluid usability. Your games will undoubtedly be sharp and realistic.

But how do you choose the best 4K gaming monitor? What are the important things you should keep in mind, and what are the best options available in the market? 

You’ve come to the right place! Get ready to learn everything you need to know before choosing the best 4K monitor.

What Are The Benefits Of A 4K Gaming Monitor?

If you are a gamer who enjoys flawless visuals, a 4K gaming monitor is your answer. There are several benefits to choosing a 4K monitor over a traditional full HD screen.

Graphical Benefits

4K gaming monitors consist of tightly packed pixels right next to one another. Moreover, 4K resolution monitors comprise 4 times more pixels than a normal full HD screen. Due to the higher number of pixels, your gaming experience will be much sharper than before. 

Smaller details like clothing and facial expressions will be visible, and even differences in texture are noticeable. 

Wide View

The best 4K gaming monitors provide a large screen surface area. Compared to a traditional full HD screen, you can see more in-game objects in the corners and the sides in a 4K gaming monitor.

A wider field of view also makes your gaming experience realistic and intense since the screen is in your direct line of vision. 

Suitable for Consoles

4K gaming monitors are suitable for all gamers, whether you prefer the PC or console systems such as the PlayStation or Xbox.

A few consoles, such as the PlayStation 4 Pro, have been developed specifically so that they can display your games in 4K. The Xbox One S also upscales a full HD image to a 4K resolution.

Prerequisites To Using A 4K Gaming Monitor

While buying a 4K gaming monitor is bound to elevate your gaming experience, there are certain prerequisites that you will have to keep in mind:

Video Card of Your PC or Laptop

Your laptop or PC must support a 4K image signal if you want to make the most of your 4K gaming monitor. Ensure that you double-check the video card that your computer has before you buy the gaming monitor.

Gaming on a 4K monitor will require the right cable and a strong and reliable video card. Here are a few video cards (graphics) that you may consider:

  • Intel Iris Plus Graphics
  • NVIDIA Quadro Series
  • Intel UHG Graphics (from the eighth-generation Intel processors)
  • AMD Radeon RX and Pro series

Connectors and Cables

For the complete 4K monitor gaming experience, you will need an HDMI, DisplayPort, USB-C, or Thunderbolt 3 connector.

VGA and DVI connectors are older variants and will not support 4K gaming monitors. HDMI 1.4 may also be sufficient but transfers images at 30Hz, making fast-moving images appear ragged and slow.

Ensure that you choose the right cable for your connector. For the best gaming experience, the cable and connector should match perfectly. For example, a Thunderbolt 3 connector with a Thunderbolt 3 cable. Signals transfer the fastest when the cable and connector match.

Things To Look For In The Best 4K Gaming Monitor

Buying a 4K gaming monitor may seem like an easy feat, but there are multiple factors to consider. Since this is a huge investment, you cannot make this decision lightly.

If you are unaware of what to look for, the guide is here to help you. Below are some essential factors that should be present in the best 4K monitor.

Monitor Size

You are buying a gaming monitor because you want to get a complete gaming experience. That is why the size of a gaming monitor becomes a very crucial factor. If you choose small sizes, you would not be able to enjoy the gaming experience.

Ideally, the gaming monitor size should not be less than 24 inches. The bigger you go, the better your experience. However, it would help if you also remembered that as the size increases, so will the price.

Refresh Rate

Refresh rate decides the quality of your visual output and the number of times that the monitor will refresh a visual in one second. Most gaming monitors come in 120Hz or 144Hz since the frame rate is high without any breakage or stuttering.

When you choose monitors with these refresh rates, you need to ensure that the GPU can support the high frame rate. (https://www.intel.com/content/www/us/en/products/docs/processors/what-is-a-gpu.html)

Some monitors come with higher refresh rates, like 165Hz or even 240Hz. As the refresh rate increases, you need to be cautious that you go for a higher GPU.

Panel Type

Monitors come in two-panel types: IPS (in-plane switching) and TN (twisted nematic). 

IPS panels are well-known for their visual quality. The picture will be more accurate in color presentation and sharpness. However, the response time is more which is not good for high-end multiplayer games.

On the other hand, the TN panel has a response time of 1ms, which is perfect for competitive gaming. Monitors having TN panels are also a more affordable choice. However, the color saturation is not great, and this could be a problem for AAA single-player games.

Response Time

Response time is then taken by a single pixel to change from black to white or other shades of grey. This is measures in milliseconds or ms.

When you buy gaming monitors, it is better to choose a higher response time since it will eradicate motion blur and ghosting (https://www.onecomputerguy.com/1ms-vs-5ms). Response time between 1ms and 4ms would be good enough for single-player games.

If you are more into playing multiplayer games, it is advisable to choose a lower response time. It would probably be better if you opt for 1ms since this would ensure no pixel response delays.

Color Accuracy

A 4K gaming monitor’s color accuracy looks into the system’s ability to provide the necessary hue level without making any rough calculations.  

A 4K gaming monitor needs to have color accuracy on the higher end of the spectrum. Most monitors follow a standard RGB pattern to enable color adjustments. But these days, sRGB is quickly becoming the best way to ensure full coverage with perfect color delivery.

The best 4K gaming monitors provide a wide color gamut based on sRGB patterns of color delivery. If the color deviates, the system will present you with an error message represented as a Delta E figure (https://www.viewsonic.com/library/creative-work/what-is-delta-e-and-why-is-it-important-for-color-accuracy/). Most experts generally consider a Delta E figure of 1.0 to be the best.

Connectors

A gaming monitor will have ports for input and output. You should try to ensure that the monitor has these connectors – DisplayPort 1.4, HDMI 1.4/2.0, or 3.5mm audio out. 

Some brands offer you other types of connectors in their monitors. However, these are the ports or connectors that are the most important. If you need to plug USB devices directly into the monitor, check for USB ports to help you do so.

Best 4K Gaming Monitors

Now that you know what to look for while choosing a 4K gaming monitor, we can jump right into some of the best options available in the market right now!

The following overviews will provide you with some details about the unique features of each of these gaming monitors and their general specifications.

Best Overall 4K Gaming Monitor: LG 27GN950-B 

Whether your priority is image quality, speed, high contrast, or accurate color, the LG 27GN950-B has it all. This would be our top recommendation since the 27GN950-B has the best input lag scores available on a 144Hz monitor.

A refresh rate of 144Hz is extremely impressive, and with the right graphics card, you will be able to make the most of this gaming monitor. However, it does have some heavy bandwidth requirements, so make sure you check your graphics card before choosing the 27GN950-B.

It also has an unmatched image quality. With additional features such as an edge array backlight with a local dimming feature, the 27GN950-B offers an impressive contrast ratio. 

Adding to this list of benefits, the LG 27GN950-B is fast, responsive, and has a wide color gamut. The Nano IPS aid this color gamut and provides 95% coverage of the DCI-P3 color space. 

The only disadvantage that you might face is that the colors may seem oversaturated, depending on your preferences. 

The LG 27GN950-B is bound to make your gaming experience worthwhile and enjoyable.

Sale
895 Reviews

Conclusion

Overall, we would highly recommend the LG 27GN950-B for all types of gamers. It has unbeatable image clarity, an impressive response rate, and a wide monitor size. It also has a response time of 1ms, which effectively eradicates motion blurring. 

If you are ready to invest a little more money in your 4K monitor, the LG 27GN950-B is the perfect choice for you.

Buy Now

Best Budget 4K Gaming Monitor: Asus TUF Gaming VG289Q

Despite the range of plus points offered by most 4K gaming monitors, they are usually quite expensive. However, the Asus TUF Gaming VG289Q is not just affordable, but it is also a great monitor with many key features that are at the top of the line.

At just $349, it offers great overall performance and visuals. The colors are accurate, and it also has a strong build quality. Refresh rate limits itself to 60Hz, but this functions well for casual gamers who can make do with sufficient detail. Hardcore gamers will probably want more Hz.

There is no doubt that a few sacrifices had to be made along the way as you will see that it has average contrast. However, for the price that the Asus TUF Gaming VG289Q is currently selling at, it has some undeniable benefits for all except hardcore gamers.

2,124 Reviews

Buy now

  • Great for novice or casual gamers
Cons
  • Unsatisfactory refresh rate for hardcore gamers
  • Response time of 5ms not suitable for multiplayer games

Conclusion

If you are looking for a satisfactory 4K gaming monitor for a very affordable price, the Asus TUF Gaming VG289Q is your perfect model. While you will definitely find other monitors with better refresh rates and response times, the VG289Q is a good start for new gamers.

Despite being much cheaper than most other 4K monitors, most of its features are still top of the line and will give you a good gaming experience.

Buy Now

Best 4K Gaming Monitor for Dark Rooms: LG OLED48CXPUB

Although the LG OLED48CXPUB is technically a TV, the input lag is low enough to be suitable for PC gaming. The OLED panel makes it ideal for gaming in a dark room as you can turn off individual pixels to produce the perfect effects.

The wide viewing angles allow the images to retain their accuracy at the sides no matter how close to the screen you choose to sit. Response time is also near-instantaneous. You will observe unhindered movement in fast-paced scenes.

The Black Frame Insertion feature improves overall quality, and the HDMI 2.1 inputs will allow you to play 4K with 120Hz for a seamless experience. 

The only concern with the LG OLED48CXPUB is the risk of permanent burn-in (https://www.rtings.com/tv/tests/picture-quality/image-retention-burn-in). This normally occurs when static elements such as the game interface remain on the screen for a longer duration. However, you can undertake steps to mitigate the risk. 

5,568 Reviews

Conclusion

The LG OLED48CXPUB is the best choice for you if you prefer gaming in the dark. You have the freedom to turn off individual pixels, and this will produce perfect effects. With a refresh rate that goes up to 120Hz, your gaming experience will be seamless and enjoyable.

You may face the risk of permanent burn-in; however, this is a resolvable issue.

Buy Now

Best 4K Gaming Monitor for HDR: Asus ROG Swift PG27UQ

The Asus ROG Swift PG27UQ provides immersive lighting due to its Aura Sync technology. It also supports synchronization with Aura-enabled components. 

For perfect synchronization, connect your ROG Swift PG27UQ to other peripherals after installing the Aura Sync software on your desktop or laptop. This will provide a stylish backdrop to your game and also syncs the lighting with the music or gaming effects. 

It doesn’t get better than the 144Hz refresh rate, and this 4K gaming monitor will guarantee the smoothest gameplay. Combined with a 27-inch IPS display and a DCI-P3 color gamut, your gaming experience will be realistic with lifelike contrast.

An interesting feature of the Asus ROG Swift PG27UQ is the built-in light sensor. Your screen will automatically adjust its brightness settings according to your environmental conditions. 

The ROG Swift PG27UQ also comes with ultra-low blue light technology. This will ensure maximum protection for your eyes, no matter how long you are in front of the screen. All you, as the gamer, have to do is choose from four filter settings available to you via the on-screen menu. 

However, the ROG Swift PG27UQ does not have Dolby Vision or motion blur reduction. This may hinder your gaming experience.

The only area where it falls short next to the 27GN950-B is that it does not have any features for motion blur reduction. However, if this is an element that you believe will not hinder your gaming, the Asus ROG Swift PG27UQ is a strong contender that you can consider.

Best 144Hz 4K Gaming Monitor: Asus ROG Strix XG27UQ

The Asus ROG Strix XG27UQ is the fastest 4K monitor out of all the options we have provided you in this review and is also much cheaper than what you would expect. Prices may range anywhere from $800 to $1000.

Even though this model does not have a premium FALD backlight for a stunning HDR display, the HDR performance is still quite satisfactory and fairly impressive. This is because of the screen’s dynamic dimming feature and the efficient edge-array backlight.

In terms of response time, the Asus ROG XG27UQ outperforms most other 4K gaming monitors, including strong competitors such as the Acer Predator X27. 

Despite outperforming Acer’s model, the Asus ROG Strix XG27UQ is cheaper. While the Acer model stands at around $2000, the ROG Strix XG27UQ hovers around $1000.

Along with FreeSync, initial tests suggest that the XG27UQ can also run G-Sync successfully, making it versatile. The monitor also has an extremely low input lag due to the Display Stream Compression (DSC) that supports the fastest possible frame rates.

Final Thoughts

The models that we have suggested for you here will guarantee a smooth, immersive, and enjoyable gaming experience. Even though all of them are viable contenders, we would definitely recommend the LG 27GN950-B over the others.

The refresh rate is unbeatable, standing at 144Hz. Combined with a response time of 1ms, the LG 27GN950-B has it all. 

Although the Asus ROG Strix XC27UQ provides a similar response time and refresh rate, it has been formally tested only for FreeSync compatibility. It has not yet been listed under G-Sync.

With a monitor size of 27 inches, the LG 27GN950-B offers a wide view, along with perfectly timed visuals. The color accuracy is unmatched, and the contrast ratio is also high. 

While it may be a little expensive, all the features and benefits it offers are worth the money you would be paying for this 4K gaming monitor.

item.title: The Best 144Hz Curved Gaming Monitor In 2021
item.dc:creator: denis
item.description: The Best 144Hz Curved Gaming Monitor In 2021 Curved gaming monitors are the new deal since they have much more to offer than flat monitors. They are not only attractive to look at, but they also provide you with many physical benefits. Curved monitors offer you a good field of view, so you do not […]
item.content:encoded:
The Best 144Hz Curved Gaming Monitor In 2021

Preview Product Rating Price
Gigabyte G34WQC 34" 144Hz Ultra-Wide Curved Gaming Monitor, 3440... 409 Reviews $449.99 Buy now
Dell 144Hz Gaming Monitor 27 Inch Curved Monitor with FHD (1920 x... 6,172 Reviews $284.00 Buy now
BenQ EX3203R 32 Inch 144Hz VA Curved Computer Gaming Monitor WQHD... 886 Reviews $259.99 Buy now
ASUS ROG Strix 31.5” 1440P Curved Gaming Monitor (XG32VQ) - QHD... 323 Reviews $617.00 Buy now
AOC CQ27G2 27" Super Curved Frameless Gaming Monitor QHD 2K,... 3,742 Reviews $299.00 Buy now

Curved gaming monitors are the new deal since they have much more to offer than flat monitors. They are not only attractive to look at, but they also provide you with many physical benefits.

Curved monitors offer you a good field of view, so you do not exert your eyes. Just like flat monitors, they come in different sizes. However, unlike flat monitors larger size does not mean more strain on your eyes or increased discomfort.

If you are looking for new gaming monitors, then these 144Hz gaming monitors are the best. They have a standard refresh rate along with enhancing your gaming experience in many different ways.

How To Choose The Best 144Hz Curved Gaming Monitor

Gamers will need to find the right monitor that will enhance their gaming experience. When making this choice, there are several factors that you need to look into. 

Below are some of those factors or features you should consider while buying the best 144Hz curved gaming monitor.

Pixel Density

When it comes to gaming monitors, you should always go for larger screen sizes. The larger your screen size, the better you experience. However, when you increase the size of the screen, you need to keep a note of the pixel density.

Pixel density is the ratio of pixels per inch of the monitor’s size and resolution.

If the pixel density is low, then the image will become pixelated. This means you will be unable to view a clear image, and this will hinder your gaming. Higher pixel density means clearer details and more screen space.

Screen Size

Like I discussed, large screen sizes are not always for the best. It is also because large screen sizes will increase your budget. For most gamers, a 27 inches screen would be best for all types of gaming experiences.

They are large but not too much to create discomfort while playing. If the screen is too large, then you need to move your head from one corner to another too much.

When you choose a 27 inches monitor, the ideal resolution will be 2560 x 1440. In this, the pixel density will be approximately 109 pixels per inch. This ensures that you get the right details and screen space without the requirement of any scaling.

Widescreen / Ultrawide Screen

The aspect ratio for both these screens is different. In Ultrawide screen, (https://www.forbes.com/sites/forbes-personal-shopper/2020/10/28/best-ultrawide-monitors-2020-samsung-aw3420dw/) you get an aspect ratio of 21:9, while in widescreen, you get an aspect ratio of 16:9.

The horizontal space for the Ultrawide screen is 33% more than the widescreen. This makes the gaming experience much more engaging. This is extremely important in certain games where you need the field of view to be wide.

Even though most new games support the Ultrawide ratio, not all would be compatible. Games that are not compatible with the 21:9 ratio will give you black borders on both sides. If you do not wish to keep the black borders, you will have to see a stretched-out image.

Response Time

The response time of your curved gaming monitor is essential. It is the time taken by the monitor to respond to your inputs. When you choose your gaming monitor, ensure that the response time is on the lower scale.

The ideal response time would fall between 1ms and 5 ms. For highly competitive games, it is always advisable to choose a lower response time, preferably 1ms. However, if you are using very large displays, then 5ms would also be quite good.

Panel Types

There are three-panel types that are VA (Vertical Alignment), TN (Twisted Nematic), and IPS (In-Panel Switching).

In TN panels, the color reproduction is not as good as IPS panels, but the refresh rates are high. You will not be satisfied with the viewing angles of TN panels, but this may not be a problem for many.

IPS panels have good image quality and color reproduction. However, the refresh rates of these panels are quite low. VA panels are good for most gaming monitors and feature the good factors of the other two panels.

Why Are The Advantages Of A Curved Gaming Monitor?

Are you unable to decide if you should go for a 144Hz curved gaming monitor or flat monitor? To clear your confusion, I have highlighted some major advantages of curved monitors.

Immersive

If the image displayed on the monitor does not attract you, you will not get a complete gaming experience. In curved monitors, a technology called ocular perception is used, making you see images like in real life.

Curved monitors take into consideration all three dimensions, which are length, breadth, and height. This gives you an immersive experience which you will not find on flat monitors.

Eradicates Distortion

No one likes a blurry image or distortion in the edges of the image. This is a very common issue in flat monitors and not so much in curved monitors. Generally, when screen size increases, the distortion also increases.

However, in curved monitors, you are unlikely to face this issue.

Comfortable

Since the distortion is low or nil, you will be more comfortable using curved monitors. Your eyes will not experience any strain, and you can play games for long hours. Moreover, even with large screens, a curved monitor will not exceed your field of view.

In flat monitors, you will need to move your head to take in the full screen. This becomes a nuisance after a certain time, which is not a problem in curved gaming monitors.

Large Field of View

Like I mentioned in the earlier point, the field of view in curved gaming monitors is better than flat monitors. Both ends of the monitor are curved to ensure that the whole screen stays within your eye range.

You will not have to move your head or eyesight sideways to capture the whole screen. A curved screen ensures that light from all directions is directed to your eye. Hence you do not have to face much ocular exertion.

item.title: How To Pick A Cpu Cooler: Best Coolers And Buying Guide
item.dc:creator: denis
item.description: We cannot underestimate the importance of proper processor cooling, altering the computer’s performance and stability. It also impacts the amount of PC usage and the possibility of overclocking the processor. The CPU is highly vulnerable to high temperatures, especially if exposed to them for an extended period. Therefore, throttling or simply lowering CPU power is […]
item.content:encoded:
We cannot underestimate the importance of proper processor cooling, altering the computer’s performance and stability. It also impacts the amount of PC usage and the possibility of overclocking the processor.

The CPU is highly vulnerable to high temperatures, especially if exposed to them for an extended period. Therefore, throttling or simply lowering CPU power is this component’s first line of protection. 

Other implications include unreliable system performance, automatic restarts, and, finally, permanent processor damage. As a result, we have to dissipate the created heat somehow, using the CPU coolers.

How To Pick A Cpu Cooler: First and foremost, you must determine the CPU socket on your motherboard. For attaching the CPU cooler, different sockets have different holes. Most coolers, on the whole, feature universal, adjustable systems that allow them to the mounting holes. It is, nonetheless, worth examining for certainty and security.

What else is there to say? First, of course, there’s the scale. You may find the dimensions of each air cooling in the product specification. 

It’s worth comparing this to the housing dimensions and the maximum height of the cooler that can fit inside such a box. The fact that some memory chips may not fit under the heat sink is also a prevalent issue.

What Is The Function Of A Cpu Cooler?

The air conditioning system’s functioning is reasonably straightforward. First, the processor’s heated core radiates heat to the IHS (so-called caps). The heat sink base catches it, which spreads them across its whole surface. Finally, they aided the heat pipes, which, when filled with a particular liquid or gas, use the convection phenomenon to convey waste heat (matter movement).

The procedure may come to an end here, depending on whether we have passive or active cooling. First, the air circulation cools the heat sink in the housing in passive coolers. Then, in current ones, the use of those fans compelling this movement. Next, even more.

How To Pick A Cpu Cooler: What Should You Look For In A Cooling Fan?

The fan is the most significant aspect of the design, irrespective of whether we select air (active) and water cooling. It is the fan that facilitates heat transfer from the radiator and cooler. So which CPU fan is the most suitable? It’s essential to pay attention to a few variables here.

Rotational Size & Speed

First and foremost, the size or speed of rotation – the greater the total flow or, the better the fan efficiency, the greater they are. However, it’s important to note that higher speeds commonly result in a more significant level of created noise. Therefore, it includes a fan with LED illumination in the CPU cooler for gamers.

Design Of The Bearing

The bearing utilized has a significant impact on the noise produced and the structure’s durability. In addition, we should consider the fan’s connection – newer models use a 4-pin plug that allows you to manage the rotation speed, for example, from the motherboard.

Is It Better To Use Aluminum Or Copper As A Heat Sink?

We may locate a heat sink for the processor in two variants: aluminum or copper, in both air coolers and water coolers. The first is significantly more common, especially in lower-cost structures. On the other hand, copper heat sinks are not widely used, and they were paired with aluminum heat sinks due to their physical qualities, yet they provide higher performance. However, they are, unfortunately, more expensive than the conventional ones.

The thermal paste is also a significant component of cooling. Therefore, we can employ both types of heat sinks with the most popular mixes.

CPU Cooling: Active Or Passive?

When should active cooling be used, more excellent, and when should passive cooling be used? How To Pick A Cpu Cooler: It all depends on our personal choices for computer work culture:

Using a fan in active coolers, which improves heat dissipation efficiency but also generates noise.

Because passive designs are fanless, they operate in perfect silence. Thus they’re worth noting if you’re looking for quiet CPU cooling.

It’s worth noting, though, that passive CPU cooling has restricted performance, so they’ll only function with low-performance standard processors.

What CPU Is Cooler Simple To Set Up?

Finally, there’s the matter of assembling; the rule of thumb here is that the smaller the item, the easier it is to install.

Because a good CPU cooler is more sophisticated, installation can be more difficult. Installing new cooling can often need removing the entire motherboard from the casing (must screw the CPU cooler mounting brackets from the bottom of the board). If we do not want or cannot disassemble the entire computer, it is worthwhile to pay attention to such criteria. However, this is not a rule because, in most circumstances, you may easily install a home processor cooling system.

Let us discuss in detail the few best CPU coolers available on the market.

Specifications:

A 10% larger LED ring enables some more vibrant RGB. A rotating top allows the logos to be re-oriented in keeping whichever position the cooler.

With a straightforward, user-friendly design, CAM delivers comprehensive capabilities. Full CAM connectivity helps manage your Kraken’s efficiency accuracy, making modifications with the press of an essential thanks to improved lighting synchronization throughout all RGB NZXT components.

With the bundled RGB 2 Aer fans, you can add stunning ambient lighting to your computer. The fans have winglet-tip control surfaces that provide excellent airflow by being as silent as conceivable. In addition, every fan features fluid dynamic hinges for near-silent long-lasting performance.

item.title: What Does The Computer Hard Disk Do And What Types, Products Related To It?
item.dc:creator: denis
item.description: A computer’s hard disc is among the most critical components. It’s where you’ll find all of your films, images, apps, and necessary software. What Does The Computer Hard Disk Do?. The hard drive is the computer’s permanent memory. It means that even after switching off the computer, all data and programs remain on it. You can […]
item.content:encoded:
A computer’s hard disc is among the most critical components. It’s where you’ll find all of your films, images, apps, and necessary software. What Does The Computer Hard Disk Do?.  The hard drive is the computer’s permanent memory. It means that even after switching off the computer, all data and programs remain on it. You can measure the capacity of a hard disc in gigabytes. 

Any computer would be incomplete without a hard drive. Its kind, capacity, and speed will vary based on whether one will install it on a desktop pc, laptop, and NAS.

The following are the components of the hard drive: 

1. An electrical outlet. 

2. Magnetic discs – these are discs used to store data. 

3. Connections between the disc and the I/O controller. 

4. A dust-proof gasket. 

5. Motor for the head. 

6. The head for writing and reading data to and from the disc. 

7. Wires that link the heads to the control systems. 

8. IDE cable – a type of cable used to connect computers that adhere to the IDE & EIDE standards. It’s in the style of a wide tape containing extended narrow plugs.

Another feature that distinguishes the hard drive is the continuous data transfer characteristic required to process huge files containing graphics, sound, and movies and burn CD-Rs. 

The disc should have a consistent data transfer rate of around 10000 KB/sec. 

Another element is the average data access time. This value controls how rapidly the disc can locate the data necessary on its surface. It is typical to provide information on average access time because quickly finding the specific data and others slowly.

It means that if we have a massive quantity of data split across multiple files, we will waste some time waiting for the disc to find new pieces of data. The fastest disc has an average access time of roughly ten milliseconds.

What Hard Disc Should You Get And Where Should You Start Looking For One? 

This kind of computer work will be the first thing you should ask yourself while selecting a hard drive for your computer. You don’t need a fast and pricey SSD drive if you only use an office suite or a web browser regularly, as well as movies with a resolution lower than Full HD.

A primary, inexpensive SSD with a bit of capacity will do for less demanding activities, as will a second large HDD for storing more data. Consider a hybrid SSHD or SSD drive if you don’t have enough space for two purposes. 

  • a solid-state drive (SSD (flash) 
  • SSHD (Hybrid) 
  • Hard Disk Drive (HDD) (magnetic, disk)

SSD 

A solid-state drive (SSD) is a storage device that uses Flash memory technology. As a result, they have a faster speed than regular disc drives, but the price per GB of capacity also increases directly. The most expensive and most significant models can hold up to 4 TB of data. 128 GB is the minimum capacity for free operation of Windows and a set of essential apps. However, remember the periodic updates & the need for workspace when purchasing an SSD disc having a capacity of at least 160 or 180GB.

Hybrid SSHD 

The SSHD is a hybrid drive that falls somewhere in the middle in terms of speed and pricing. We are obtaining the Efficiency advantages thanks to a small amount of Flash me. The use of HDD disc technology allows you to maintain a large capacity at a reasonable price.

HDD

Also known as magnetic disc drives, HDDs are older disc drives that provide a large capacity for a low price and slower write and read speed than more recent SSDs. It’s also worth noting that the HDD is more susceptible to mechanical damage due to its moving mechanical parts. 

When handled, it is frequently destroying particularly true about external drives, such as dropping onto a hard surface.

How Much The Capacity Of Your Hard Drive? 

The critical criteria in determining a laptop/computer hard drive are for utilizing the Device. It’s important to note that the web browser & text documents only take up a small amount of space. 

Hard Disc In A Laptop 

What Does The Computer Hard Disk Do? You could choose the SSD drive with the space of 128 – 500GB again for the fastest possible pace or even an HDD with a distance of 1TB or more to store significant amounts of information – such as images, movies, or music – when purchasing or extending a business notebook.

Hard Disc For The Desktop 

Almost the exact requirements apply to a desktop computer, except that motherboards have supported at least two hard drives for many years. Combining a fast SSD drive with a less expensive, larger HDD is a popular approach. If we want to save a significant number of Full HD movies from a smartphone, for example, 1 TB of free space is a suitable minimum.

There are many hard disks available online and also in shops. We would discuss a few hard disks available on the market in detail below.

item.title: 6 Best Low Budget Gaming Graphics Cards for Ryzen 5 5600x
item.dc:creator: denis
item.description: With Ryzen 5000 processors, everything is simple and straightforward. The performance of the 6-core 12-thread AMD Ryzen 5 5600X is higher than the 8-core Intel Core i7-10700K. Compared with the Intel Core i5-10600K, its operating and turbo frequency is also lower. AMD Ryzen 5 3600 is one of the most popular processors, characterized by an optimal price-performance […]
item.content:encoded:
With Ryzen 5000 processors, everything is simple and straightforward. The performance of the 6-core 12-thread AMD Ryzen 5 5600X is higher than the 8-core Intel Core i7-10700K. Compared with the Intel Core i5-10600K, its operating and turbo frequency is also lower.

AMD Ryzen 5 3600 is one of the most popular processors, characterized by an optimal price-performance ratio (specifications: 6 cores, 12 threads, clock speed – 3.6 – 4.2 GHz, L3 cache – 32 MB, power consumption – 65 W).

The six cores and twelve threads are enough to handle any modern title. Still, of course, you need a powerful graphics card with this processor, and we are here with a few different options of the best graphics card for Ryzen 5 5600X.to consider in 2021 or even beyond. However, the Ryzen 5 5600X is the cheapest that offers Zen3 architecture, but the performance matches some of Intel’s high-end competitors. 

Pairing a cheap graphics card does not make sense, and we must opt ​​for a high-end option or at least a mid-range one. This article contains the top 6 graphics cards for the Ryzen 5 5600X; which one to choose is up to you, depending on the budget. 

Top 6 AMD Ryzen 5 5600X graphic card:

Preview Product Rating Price
ZOTAC Gaming GeForce RTX 2060 6GB GDDR6 192-bit Gaming Graphics... 1,142 Reviews $299.99 Buy now
MSI Gaming GeForce RTX 3090 24GB GDRR6X 384-Bit HDMI/DP Nvlink... 144 Reviews $1,650.00 Buy now
ASUS TUF Gaming NVIDIA GeForce RTX 3080 OC Edition Graphics Card-... 278 Reviews $985.00 Buy now
XFX RX 5600 XT THICC II PRO -14GBPS 6GB GDDR6 BOOST UP TO 1620MHz... 2,325 Reviews $479.00 Buy now

EVGA GeForce GTX 1070 Gaming ACX 3.0 Black Edition Graphic Cards... 2,182 Reviews $199.00 Buy now

We are precisely interested in the combination of video cards with the AMD Ryzen 5 5600X processor. With this processor, you can even grab a GeForce RTX 3090. Previously, for the Ryzen 5 3600X, the maximum allowed was the RTX 3080. Let’s discuss over here:

ZOTAC Gaming RTX 2060

The Zotac Gaming GeForce RTX 2060 Super Mini has proven itself as a sound mid-range graphics card in benchmarks. It is almost a complete replacement for the RTX 2070. The card’s performance is sufficient for gaming, especially in Full HD resolution. At 1440p, the device also performs well, but there is not enough power for Ultra-HD gaming. In the synthetic gaming benchmark 3DMark Fire Strike, the RTX 2060 shows almost identical results to the RTX-2070 models without overclocking and outperforms the stock RTX 2060 by about 10%.

The GeForce RTX 2060 Superbase frequency is now at 1470 MHz (for the RTX 2060 – 1365 MHz, for the RTX 2070 – 1410 MHz), and its clock speed is also increased. The Boost frequency is 1650 MHz is lower than the RTX 2060 (1680 MHz) but higher than the RTX 2070 (1620 MHz). However, this does not prevent the RTX 2060 Super from catching up with the RTX 2070 and significantly outperforming the RTX 2060. The card is only 21 centimeters long, making it a good choice for a compact desktop system. The maximum temperature under heavy load was 74 degrees. This makes this model one of the hottest, but the indicators are still within the acceptable range.

1,142 Reviews
ZOTAC Gaming RTX 2060
  • New turing architecture, real-time raytracing, dlss with deep learning ai
  • 6gb 192-bit gddr6
  • Dual slot, super compACt 8.3-inch card, fits 99% of systems
  • 4k, HDR, VR ready
$299.99
Buy now
Pros
  • High performance for 11440p and 080p gaming
  • Quiet cooling
  • Low power consumption
Cons
  • No technical innovation
  • Poor performance for ray tracing

Conclusion

Zotac Gaming GeForce RTX 2070 Super AMP has an excellent design, both external and in terms of PCB layout, combined with an efficient and, notably, quiet cooling system. Even the backlight is close to ideal, but it is done reasonably, and if necessary, it will be easy to turn it off. In short, Zotac Gaming GeForce RTX 2070 is ideal for those who do not care so much. 

Buy Now

MSI GeForce RTX 3090 Supreme X

MSI Suprim X is a series of gaming graphics cards that is now the manufacturer’s top-end, displacing the Gaming X Trio from the pedestal. We decided to take a closer look at its older representative – RTX 3090. Our review will tell you about the advantages and disadvantages of this video card.

Recently, the Gaming X Trio line was the oldest among MSI graphics cards. In recent years, faster models have also been released, called Lightning Z, which offered higher performance due to carefully selected components and various improvements. However, MSI has now introduced the new Supreme X line, which is now considered the highest-level – it includes custom versions of the RTX 3070, 3080 3090… At the same time, the Gaming X Trio models have not gone anywhere, but they simply turned out to be shifted from the pedestal by the new Supreme X products, which, due to the higher TDP limit in the BIOS, offer higher performance.

Due to the higher power consumption limit and more efficient cooling system, the MSI GeForce RTX 3090 Suprim X should be more potent than the corresponding Nvidia Founders Edition. The MSI GeForce RTX 3090 Suprim X copes well with any games, except for single projects where the frame counter drops below 60 fps in 4K ( the same Cyberpunk 2077).

The MSI GeForce RTX 3090 Suprim X build quality is excellent; it looks and feels like a premium segment. The backplate and the plate covering the cooling system are made of aluminum, although the latter has decorative plastic inserts. 

144 Reviews
MSI GeForce RTX 3090 Supreme X
  • Memory Speed:19.5 Gbps.Digital Max Resolution:7680x4320
  • Chipset: NVIDIA GeForce RTX 3090
  • TRI FROZR 2 Thermal Design
  • Video Memory: 24GB GDDR6X
$1,650.00
Buy now
